patient_information: Age: 62 years Sex: female Country of origin: Ethiopia Occupation: physically active Health status: fit and well
history_of_present_illness: Onset: three days after arrival in Europe Symptoms: ["difficulty chewing", "stiffness of the mouth"] Duration: approximately one week Progression: initially mild, became more severe over time
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel history: recent travel to rural Ethiopia Risk factors: ["agricultural work", "being from a country and age group in which vaccination is unlikely to have occurred"] Symptoms prior to travel: no symptoms reported prior to travel
labs_and_diagnostics: Tests performed: ["ESR to exclude GCA", "antibiotic treatment with metronidazole and antitoxin", "intrathecal administration of antitoxin", "prophylactic tracheotomy"] Results: ["no abnormal findings on examination", "improved symptoms after treatment"]
differential_diagnosis: Considered: ["tetanus", "giant cell arteritis (GCA)", "other causes of stiffness in mastication"] Evidence for tetanus: ["clinical presentation consistent with tetanus", "no other significant findings on examination", "improvement after treatment"]
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: ["antibiotic (metronidazole)", "antitoxin injection", "intrathecal antitoxin administration", "prophylactic tracheotomy"] Outcomes: ["improved symptoms after treatment", "slow recovery over 3 weeks", "no complications documented"]
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: Tetanus Confirmation method: antibiotic treatment and clinical improvement Evidence for alternatives rejected: ["no other significant findings on examination", "improvement after treatment"]
